sentences: Jesse Garba Abaga was born on 10 August 1984 to Chris and Lydia Abaga.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He grew up in Jos and is a member of Taraba State's Jukun ethnic group.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: His father is a pastor and his mother is a gospel artist and counselor.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He joined his church's choir at the age of seven and later learned to play the drums on his parents' drum kit.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He recorded an unreleased album with the short-lived music group Gospel Insanity in 2003.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: A year later, Abaga formed the group Eleven Thirty; they enjoyed local success before disbanding in 2006.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Abaga first released music under the stage name Jesse Jagz shortly thereafter with his first hit single "Africa" in 2006, topping the charts of several local radio stations in northern Nigeria.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2007, three of his singles had similar success, peaking within the Top 10 on several radio charts in the region.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Jesse Jagz has produced songs for several artists, including Majek Fashek, M. I Abaga, Banky W, Ice Prince, Mode 9, and Proverb and Dekunle Fuji.
section: == Music career == | === 1984–2009: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In February 2009, he represented Nigeria at the Sauti Za Busara Music Festival.

sentences: Jesse Jagz released his debut studio album Jag of All Tradez on 21 April 2010.

sentences: It included the singles "Wetin Dey", "Pump It Up", "Jesse Swag", "Sugar Cane Baby" and "Bend Down Low".
section: == Music career == | === 2010–2013: Jag of All Tradez, Chocolate City exit and Jagz Nation, Vol.1. Thy Nation Come ===

sentences: The album was produced entirely by Jesse Jagz and went platinum in Nigeria two months after its release.
section: == Music career == | === 2010–2013: Jag of All Tradez, Chocolate City exit and Jagz Nation, Vol.1. Thy Nation Come ===

sentences: Described as a commercially driven pop project, the album was experimental in nature.
section: == Music career == | === 2010–2013: Jag of All Tradez, Chocolate City exit and Jagz Nation, Vol.1. Thy Nation Come ===

sentences: In an interview with Adeoye Arubayi, Jagz said the album was a learning process and a way for him to explore the different music markets in Nigeria.

sentences: Jag of All Tradez received generally mixed reviews from music critics.

sentences: Keeps Magazine commended the album's production and Jesse Jagz's delivery, but ended the review saying that the record should have been shortened to ten songs.

sentences: Oye Akd of 360nobs granted the album an overall verdict of 7.5 stars out of 10, commending it for being a diverse body of work that contained a "mixture of beats and rhymes that exemplify where Nigerian hip-hop should be today".
section: == Music career == | === 2010–2013: Jag of All Tradez, Chocolate City exit and Jagz Nation, Vol.1. Thy Nation Come ===

sentences: Adeyinka Yusuff of BellaNaija awarded the album a 5/10 rating, praising its overall production while simultaneously criticizing its experimental nature.

sentences: In March 2013, Jesse Jagz announced his voluntary exit from Chocolate City and the launch of his own independent outfit Jagz Nation.
section: == Music career == | === 2010–2013: Jag of All Tradez, Chocolate City exit and Jagz Nation, Vol.1. Thy Nation Come ===

sentences: Several media outlets such as Nigerian Entertainment Today and Pulse Nigeria reported that Chocolate City accused Jesse Jagz of owing them money and being a marijuana addict.

sentences: However, the label debunked the reports through their PR firm, World PR Media.
section: == Music career == | === 2010–2013: Jag of All Tradez, Chocolate City exit and Jagz Nation, Vol.1. Thy Nation Come ===

sentences: In an interview with Kolapo Olapoju, Jesse Jagz said he left Chocolate City because he got tired performing songs from his Jag of All Tradez album for three consecutive years.
section: == Music career == | === 2010–2013: Jag of All Tradez, Chocolate City exit and Jagz Nation, Vol.1. Thy Nation Come ===

sentences: Moreover, he told Vanguard newspaper the label's management had showed little interest in promoting a track he recorded.

sentences: Jesse Jagz signed a new record deal with Chocolate City in 2015.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: He produced several tracks on the label's 2015 compilation album The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation (TICBN).
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: The album's release celebrated the merger of Loopy Music and Chocolate City as well as his return.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: TICBN was released to the general public two weeks following its exclusive release on Star Music.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: It included the singles "Summer Time" and "Suite 99".
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: In December 2016, Jesse Jagz performed with Femi Kuti and Niniola at a live music concert held at the Sheraton Hotel in Abuja.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: In 2017, Jesse Jagz announced his departure from Chocolate City for the second time.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: He told The Punch newspaper that he left in order to have more creative control over his music.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: In June 2017, Jesse Jagz unveiled the cover art for his new studio album Odysseus on his Instagram profile.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: The cover features a picture of his mother as a child, sitting with Jan Boer's three biological children.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: The photo was taken in the grounds of Boer's idyllic Jos home.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Jesse Jagz had originally began production on Odysseus in August 2014, and the album was initially scheduled for release in 2015 but was delayed multiple times.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Its title was inspired by the Greek king Odysseus.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Jesse Jagz performed tracks from the album to select listeners at an Industry Nite event held in June 2017 at Spice Route in Victoria Island, Lagos.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Odysseus was released on 8 September 2017.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: It features collaborations with Hotyce, Styl-Plus, Cynthia Morgan, Melon and Burna Boy.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Prior to releasing the album, Jesse Jagz released a number of singles in 2017, including "Midnight Vibes" and "New World".
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: "Best in You" was released as a pre-released single.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Odysseus draws influences from Caribbean sounds, supporting the dancehall identity that Jesse Jagz embraced on his second studio album Jagz Nation, Vol.1.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Thy Nation Come (2013).
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Although built on a predominantly hip-hop foundation, some of the tracks on Odysseus are infused with Caribbean rhythm and patois-laced rap.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: On 29 May 2020, Jesse Jagz released Garba, a 5-track extended play named after his traditional surname.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: He produced it with assistance from Geekbeatz and Misty.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: The EP is a mixture of Afropop, trap music, hip-hop and folk music; it features collaborations with Anchorman and Mr Murph.
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Motolani Alake of Pulse Nigeria awarded Garba a rating of 6.8 out of 10, praising its production and saying it "beautifully sells Jagz's tales with natural honesty and storytelling".
section: == Music career == | === 2015–present: The Indestructible Choc Boi Nation, Odysseus and Garba ===

sentences: Conversely, Alake criticized Jesse Jagz for letting the EP be about "lyrical brilliance and storytelling" rather than "an out-of-body sonic experience".
